text:
Hey <@U070H34HTFT> 
The main concept you have to recreate is that the HubSpot tracking code creates a cookie in the browser called `HubSpotutk`. The value of this cookie is sent along to HubSpot on every page view (it works similarly to how Google analytics works). This cookie value has to be associated to a HubSpot contact record by one of a few ways. The 2 most relevant here:
1. via a form submission (HubSpot forms capture his automatically) or the forms API 
2. The JavaScript tracking code API making an `identify` call and then a `track page view` or `track custom event` call
Assuming you’re able to write JavaScript and programmatically interact with the WebinarGeek form, you can either submit to the HS Forms API after the WebinarGeek form submission and include the HubSpotutk and email address. Or, fire identify and a custom event 

• look for the HubSpotutk/ `hutk` <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form|https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>
• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code>
• I wrote this and should help you out <https://gist.github.com/robertainslie/b110b8275beee1b27255c4d6e2ba2e8c|https://gist.github.com/robertainslie/b110b8275beee1b27255c4d6e2ba2e8c>

Hello everyone! When a Task is created, it is assigned to the one who created it. Would it be possible somehow that associating to the Task a AAAA Deal, this Task would be assigned to the owner of that Deal?
Thank you very much!
Regards!
